basics.name: Zoher Kachwala
basics.label: PhD Candidate in Computer Science
basics.summary: PhD candidate specializing in Natural Language Processing (LLMs), AI Alignment, and Reliable Machine Learning. My research centers on novel steering techniques to improve safety, controllability, and interpretability in LLMs/VLMs: Zero-shot detection of AI-generated images through task-aligned prompting of VLMs, supporting authenticity verification and content trust. Community-aware content moderation, using LLMs to interpret user history and apply nuanced, rule-grounded moderation at scale. Controlled reasoning in LLMs, analyzing decoding dynamics to guide generation toward faithful, safe, and interpretable outputs.

publications.name: Advanced Heuristics for LLM Decoding Improve Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
publications.abstract: Proposes novel decoding strategies to enhance LLM reasoning, improving explainability, alignment, and reliability in complex generation tasks.

publications.name: Hyper-Contextual Steering: Community-Aware Moderation with LLMs
publications.abstract: Develops prompting methods for context-sensitive alignment of LLMs with community guidelines and user intent for automated moderation.
